page.title: 10Road Network
page.content: The major road in the area is the A53 trunkroad between Shrewsbury and Buxton via the Potteries.Until 1973 this road passed through the narrow town centre of Market Drayton but is now carried by a purpose built by-pass to the N.W. of the town.The A529 is the major N.S. route but is fairly quiet.The town centre streets converge on a wide High Street.A new inner ring road to ease congestion in the narrow streets is partly completed.There is an ongoing debate about a one way system and pedestrianisation of the shopping centre.Local traders are against such development.The rural roads are narrow and regular complaints about there upkeep are voiced.Public spending cuts are blamed.
